title: The New York Times
main-image-alt: Drifter Shoots aka Isaac Wright on cover of New York Times
right-title:
A Rogue Climber
 Running From the Law Was Fleeing His Own Trauma
right-description: A former paratrooper became an “urban explorer“, scaling the tops of bridges and buildings to help ease his PTSD. He now faces criminal charges in several states.

title: First Day Out
main-image-alt: Drifter Shoots aka Isaac Wright sitting on cable of bridge overlooking New York City
right-description: “April 9th, 2021 was my first day out. I had $9,000 left in my savings and five lawyers I had no idea how I would pay.”

title: Digital Diaspora Pt. 2
main-image-alt: Man in jacket that says 'Fear of a Black Planet'
right-description: Diana Sinclair and Driftershoots hosted a Juneteenth art exhibition, public installation, and fundraising auction centered around the works of Black artists for NFT.NYC 2022.

title: Where My Vans Go
main-image-alt: Shoes overlooking bridge from top of bridge arch
right-description: Where My Vans Go is a collection comprised of 124 iconic images created over the span of three years exploring all over the United States. From coast to coast, between borders and beyond, this series represents the journey that has forged the person and artist that I am today.
